fixes.name: Index
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR IndexValue =
    RANKX(
        ALLSELECTED('Sheet1 (waffle template)'),
        1,
        ,
        ASC,
        DENSE
    )
RETURN
    (IndexValue - 1) * 2
fixes.solution_explanation: INDEX() is a Tableau table calculation (row position within the partition). In DAX there is no direct INDEX() equivalent; the common approach is to use RANKX over the desired partition/order. This measure uses RANKX(ALLSELECTED(...), 1, , ASC, DENSE) as a placeholder to generate a positional rank and then applies the arithmetic (Index - 1) * 2. To make this behave exactly like the original Tableau INDEX(), replace the expression argument (currently 1) with the appropriate ordering expression or column that defines row order within the partition.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses the INDEX() table calculation which depends on the visual/table context, so it must be implemented as a measure in Power BI.
